Bonjour, Hello!

I am a master student at the McGill Graphics & Imaging Lab (GIL), working under Derek Nowrouzezahrai. My main research interests lie at the intersection of physically-based rendering and machine learning. More precisely, I am interested in applying deep learning techniques to light transport simulations.

If you'd like to chat, feel free to send me an email.

Latest News (See more )

2018.11.18
I will be presenting (with D. Rioux & N. Vibert) some of our early work on MCMC for rendering at MOTOGRAPH held at Université de Montréal.
2018.11.10
I will be starting my Ph.D. at McGill in January 2019.
2018.05.12
I will be attending Interactive 3D Graphics and Games (i3D) 2018 held at Ubisoft Montréal.

Selected Projects (See more )

Nenufar Renderer

Work-in-progress physically-based renderer written in C++11 with a focus on state-of-the-art light transport algorithms and material models.

Implementing Noise2Noise

PyTorch implementation of Noise2Noise: Learning Image Restoration without Clean Data by Lehtinen et al.

Reproducing L2HMC

ICLR 2018 Reproducibility Challenge for Generalizing Hamiltonian Monte Carlo with Neural Networks by Lévy et al.
